content: <?xml version="1.0"?> <vocabulary id="file_format_id"> <terms> <term> <id>ASCII</id> <description>Text file format. Should contain a header describing contents of the file, including units.</description> </term> <term> <id>ASCII:ESRI</id> <description>ESRI ASCII grid format. The first six lines indicate georeferencing information for the grid, followed by the values listed in the order they would naturally appear (left-right, top-down).</description> </term> <term> <id>ASCII:GMRT</id> <description>Bill Haxby format ASCII "files" file used for GMRT ingestion</description> </term> <term> <id>ASCII:MBSystemSVP</id> <description>MBSystem standard sound velocity profile text file format.</description> </term> <term> <id>Binary</id> <description>A file formatted using the binary numeral system, or base-2 number system, representing using two symbols, usually 0 and 1. Must be accompanied by a full description of the file format.</description> </term> <term> <id>Binary:GMRT</id> <description>Bill Haxby format binary grd1 files used for GMRT ingestion. </description> </term> <term> <id>BMP</id> <description>Image file format, stands for BitMap</description> </term> <term> <id>CARIS</id> <description>Caris HIPS-formatted file</description> </term> <term> <id>CNV</id> <description>Seabird binary vendor format.</description> </term> <term> <id>CSS:3.0</id> <description>NNSA Core Table Data-base Schema CSS 3.0</description> </term> <term> <id>DIPOLE1D</id> <description>Format for controlled-source electromagnetic and magnetotelluric data</description> </term> <term> <id>DOC</id> <description>Microsoft Word Document</description> </term> <term> <id>DTF</id> <description>HOBO Temperature Probe binary vendor format</description> </term> <term> <id>EDF</id> <description>Sippican MK21 Export Data File</description> </term> <term> <id>GEOJPEG</id> <description>A georeferenced JPEG image</description> </term> <term> <id>GEOTIFF</id> <description>A TIFF based interchange format for georeferenced raster imagery. </description> </term> <term> <id>GIF</id> <description>Image file format stands for Graphics Interchange Format</description> </term> <term> <id>HMRG</id> <description>Hawaii in-house BS (bathymetry/sidescan) binary file format developed over recent decades to handle data sets from the DSL-120, IMI30, MR1 and similar HMRG platforms.</description> </term> <term> <id>HTML</id> <description>Webpage - Hypertext Transfer Protocol.</description> </term> <term> <id>JGOFS</id> <description>An ASCII file format designed by the Joint Global Ocean Flux Study to store underway hydrographic, weather and ship state information.</description> </term> <term> <id>JPEG</id> <description>An image file format, best suited for photographs, that can contain 16.7 million colors (24-bit color information), and cannot use transparency.</description> </term> <term> <id>JSF</id> <description>EdgeTech raw sidescan, also MBSystem format 132.</description> </term> <term> <id>KEB</id> <description>Knudsen binary format.</description> </term> <term> <id>KMZ</id> <description>Google Earth ASCII file format (kmz or kml) written in Keyhole Markup Language</description> </term> <term> <id>MATLAB</id> <description>Binary MATLAB vendor format. </description> </term> <term> <id>MBSystem</id> <description>Multibeam data formats from various manufacturers that can be read with the open source MBSystem package</description> </term> <term> <id>MGD77</id> <description>Marine Geophysical Data Exchange Format developed in 1977 - an ASCII file format for marine geophysical data (bathymetry, magnetics, and gravity).</description> </term> <term> <id>MGDS:CTD</id> <description>MGDS ASCII CTD basic format</description> </term> <term> <id>MGDS:Nav</id> <description>ASCII navigation file format that includes date/time, longitude and latitude.</description> </term> <term> <id>MOV</id> <description>Quicktime Movie</description> </term> <term> <id>MP4</id> </term> <term> <id>NetCDF</id> <description>Network Common Data Form</description> </term> <term> <id>NetCDF:GMT</id> <description>The standard GMT .grd file format for gridded data.</description> </term> <term> <id>NotApplicable</id> <description>Multiple file formats</description> </term> <term> <id>NotProvided</id> <description>Not Provided</description> </term> <term> <id>P1</id> <description>U.K.O.O.A. P1/90 exchange format for raw marine positioning data in common use in oil and gas industry.</description> </term> <term> <id>P2</id> <description>U.K.O.O.A. P2/94 exchange format for raw marine positioning data in common use in oil and gas industry.</description> </term> <term> <id>PBO:Velocity</id> <description>PBO GPS Velocity Field ASCII Format</description> </term> <term> <id>PDF</id> <description>Portable Document Format</description> </term> <term> <id>PH5</id> <description>IRIS PASSCAL format that improves upon the SEG-Y format</description> </term> <term> <id>PNG</id> <description>Image file format stands for Portable Network Format. </description> </term> <term> <id>R2R:Nav</id> <description>ISO-compliant ASCII navigation file format comprising date/time, longitude and latitude. Standard navigation file format of the Rolling Deck to Repository (R2R) Program.</description> </term> <term> <id>RDF</id> <description>GeoSwath Sonar Raw Data File</description> </term> <term> <id>SAC</id> <description>IRIS PASSCAL format used with Seismic Analysis Code (SAC) software</description> </term> <term> <id>SD</id> <description>Fledermaus 3D visualization file format. Files can be viewed with a free viewer available at http://www.ivs3d.com.</description> </term> <term> <id>SEASOFT</id> <description>Sea-Bird proprietary format. Conversion software available at website.</description> </term> <term> <id>SEED</id> <description>Standard for the Exchange of Earthquake Data (SEED)</description> </term> <term> <id>SEGD</id> <description>One of several standards developed by the Society of Exploration Geophysicists for storing geophysical data.</description> </term> <term> <id>SEGY</id> <description>One of several standards developed by the Society of Exploration Geophysicists for storing geophysical data. Originally developed for storing single-line seismic digital data.</description> </term> <term> <id>SHP</id> <description>Shapefiles - A popular geospatial vector data format for geographic information systems software. The format is developed and regulated by ESRI as a (mostly) open specification for data interoperability among ESRI and other software products. Shapefiles spatially describe geometries: points, polylines, and polygons. </description> </term> <term> <id>SIO86</id> <description>Custom format from Scripps Institution of Oceanography (SIO) for eXpendable BathyThermograph data.</description> </term> <term> <id>TIFF</id> <description>Tagged Image File Format</description> </term> <term> <id>UHDAS</id> <description>University of Hawaii Data Acquisition System format for ADCP data</description> </term> <term> <id>XLS</id> <description>Microsoft Excel binary vendor file format. Can be accommodated, but ASCII files are preferred to ensure longevity of access to data files.</description> </term> <term> <id>XML</id> <description>Extensible Markup Language (XML)</description> </term> <term> <id>XTF</id> <description>eXtended Triton Format (XTF) is a Triton Imaging, Inc. file format for recording various types of hydrographic survey data.</description> </term> <term> <id>ZIP</id> <description>Compressed file archive format</description> </term> </terms> </vocabulary>
